source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Salvia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Salvia. In: Walsh, N.G, Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Vol. 4 Dicotyledons Cornaceae to Asteraceae, pp. 428-430. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Bracts of young inflorescences soon caducous; branches not covered with maroon-purple hairs, hence not appearing purplish; leaves on abaxial surface with scattered reddish-brown, red or orange sessile glands

Bracts of inflorescence persistent at least until the fruiting stage; branches covered with maroon-purple multicelled hairs, hence branches usually purplish; leaves on abaxial surface with abundant yellow or honey-coloured sessile glands
Corolla bluish-mauve, rarely pink or pale blue, with darker purple spots on upper lip; leaf margin not ciliate; calyx with occasional multicellular hairs
Corolla whitish, freely speckled with purple on the inner surface of the lips; leaf margin and calyx ciliate with purplish multicellular hairs
